title: Resident Medical Officer- MBBS Only
tagsAndSkills: patient care,clinical,Emergency Medicine,quality improvement,critical care,Medical,medical records,hospital
jobDescription:
GENERAL JOB DESCRIPTION

Clinical Management of Patients

  • Complete admission examination on each patient when appropriate and document clinical findings.
  • Attend ward rounds with consultants, as required, and be available to discuss patient treatment plans.
  • Provide a 24-hour medical service by rotation basis
  • Inform admitting consultants of changes in medical condition of patients and of relevant action taken.
  • To undertake a daily morning and evening ward-round ensuring all patients are visited.
  • To record in the patients notes as appropriate patient examinations, communication or procedures. All entries to be signed, dated and timed
  • Follow the instructions of consultants for their specific regime for each individual patient.
  • Perform clinical procedures as requested by consultant medical staff and nursing staff, these may include phlebotomy and monitoring of intravenous drugs given to patients.
  • Initiate and alter in-patient prescriptions at consultants request.
  • Write up to shift out from Critical care area” for patients as required.
  • Visit patients as required at the request of the nursing staff.
  • To be familiar with all relevant procedures/policies.
  • To be familiar with Apollo Hospitals clinical policies.
  • To be aware of the Apollo Hospitals clinical risk programme and report clinical incidents, drug errors and near misses.
  • To participate in clinical audit and implementation of clinical governance.
  • To participate and assist with clinical procedures as required.
  • He/She should be part of the quality improvement of JCI documentation process of the hospital.
  • Under no circumstances should RMOs seek consent for operations or procedures on behalf of a Consultant.
  • RMOs must seek consent for any procedures that they intend to undertake. This will be clearly documented in the medical records.

Operational

  • To be completely familiar with emergency equipment.
  • To record all treatments performed in patient notes.
  • To provide a full report/handover to Resident Medical Officer commencing the next shift.

Emergency

  • To carry out CPR and other Emergency Procedures as per hospital policy.
  • To initiate emergency treatments for patients, staff and visitors and complete appropriate documentation.
  • Can initiate emergency medical care as required within the Critical care area for medical and surgical emergencies.

In-Service Education & Promotion of the Hospital

  • Promote patient care by liaison with all departments.
  • Participate in the in-service education programme, inclusive of CPR, Health & Safety Training and Fire and other JCI related.
  • Ensure medical competence by continual professional development and reading of current medical journals.
  • Promote the hospital by showing empathy and compassion to patients, their families and friends.
  • Promote the hospital by demonstrating a customer –focused approach at all times to patients, consultants and staff.

Health and Safety

  • Take reasonable care of the health and safety of themselves and all other persons who may be affected by their acts or omissions at work.
  • Co-operate with their employer to ensure compliance with Health and Safety legislation and the Health and Safety policies and procedures of the treatment centre, not intentionally or recklessly interfere with, or misuse, anything provided in the interests of health, safety, or welfare, in pursuance of any of the relevant statutory provisions.

Data Protection

The post holder must at all times respect the confidentiality of information. This includes, if required to do so, obtain, process and/or use information held on a computer in a fair and lawful way, to hold data only for the specified registered purposes and to use or disclose data only to authorised persons or organisations as instructed.

This list of duties and responsibilities is not exhaustive and the post holder may be required to undertake other relevant and appropriate duties as reasonably required. This job description is subject to regular review and appropriate modification.

title: Software Development Engineer
tagsAndSkills: apple ios application development,version control,ios,git,design patterns,rest,algorithms,c++
jobDescription:
Project Role :Software Development Engineer


Project Role Description :Analyze, design, code and test multiple components of application code across one or more clients. Perform maintenance, enhancements and/or development work.
Must have skills :Apple iOS Application Development

Good to have skills :NA
Minimum 3 year(s) of experience is required

Educational Qualification :15 years full time Education
Summary:As a Software Development Engineer, you will be responsible for analyzing, designing, coding, and testing multiple components of application code across one or more clients. Your typical day will involve working on Apple iOS application development, performing maintenance, enhancements, and/or development work.
Roles & Responsibilities:
  • Design and develop high-quality, scalable, and maintainable iOS applications using Swift and Objective-C.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features.
  • Perform code reviews, write unit tests, and ensure code quality and maintainability.
  • Stay updated with the latest advancements in iOS application development and integrate innovative approaches for sustained competitive advantage. Professional & Technical Skills:
  • Must To Have Skills:Proficiency in Apple iOS application development using Swift and Objective-C.
  • Good To Have Skills:Experience with other mobile platforms such as Android.
  • Strong understanding of iOS application architecture and design patterns.
  • Experience with RESTful APIs and JSON.
  • Solid grasp of Git and other version control systems.
  • Experience with Agile development methodologies. Additional Information:
  • The candidate should have a minimum of 3 years of experience in Apple iOS application development.
  • The ideal candidate will possess a strong educational background in computer science or a related field, along with a proven track record of delivering impactful iOS applications.
  • This position is based at our Bengaluru office.Qualifications15 years full time Education

title: Android Developer
jobDescription:
Solvios Technology is looking for Android Developer to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey.
  1. Conceptualizing and formulating apps that are suitable for use on all types of Android devices.
  2. Implementing measures to safeguard users' data.
  3. Ensuring that the construction and presentation of your apps are congruent with the company's standards.
  4. Proofreading your code and correcting mistakes before each app is released.
  5. Collaborating with UI and UX Designers, as well as Software Testers, to ensure that each app is presentable and in perfect working order.
  6. Liaising with the marketing department to ensure consistency in our company's 'voice' across the board.
  7. Monitoring app reviews to detect areas for improvement.
  8. Creating app updates, including bug fixes and additional features, for release.

title: Team Leader - Client Services Voice
tagsAndSkills: International Voice Process,Inbound Voice Process,Customer Support,International Call Center,Voice Process,Voice Support,International Calling,Voice
jobDescription:
Title: Team Leader - Client Services Voice

Location: Airoli Navi Mumbai.

Interested candidates can share the resume on keerthirajesh.karnati@sscinc.com, tatiana.bhowmik@sscinc.com.


Role Overview:

To support the Team Manager to motivate, coach and develop a team of associates who are handling incoming Enquiry and Dealing calls from Retail clients. Responsible for ensuring the team provide a quality service for all clients and respond in line with the Management Company service level agreements and key performance indicators. Seek opportunities to improve the customer experience, Putting Client at The heart to ensure a culture of continuous improvement.


Responsibilities and Duties:


• Intraday monitoring of the team to ensure schedule adherence is achieved.

•Working with UK counterparts including meeting attendance. All communications will be in the English language.

• Ensures managers are kept informed on work volumes, process changes and issues.

• Deputies for Team Manager both internally and externally.

• Investigates and validates incidents logged against the teams. • Coaching staff, providing feedback from quality checks.

• Contributes to team motivation and achievement.

• Ensure SS&C meets their clients expectations, in line with the CSV Service Level Agreements (SLA) and Key Performance Indicators (KPI). Encouraging the team to keep the client at the heart of all they do.

• Support the Team Manager in planning the resource effectively through Verint to achieve telephone SLAs, including communicating the scheduling plans with the teams.

• Procedure and process reviews and that they are appropriately controlled, monitored, and updated in the requested timeframes.

• Escalation and referral point for the team, internal and external queries.

• Investigate any complaints and collaborate with other areas to ensure a detailed response is completed. • Monitoring the Teams control (OCP) completion

• Working with the Team Manager of CSV Voice preparing for oversight and audit meetings • Maintain a strong focus on quality and team efficiency.

• To ensure all regulatory training is completed within timescales for self and team.

• Ensure all activities are undertaken in accordance with procedures & controls, and that any changes to activities implications are considered



Core Requirements Qualifications/personal skills:


  • Proficiency in the English (UK) language is essential, both spoken and written language skills are required.
  • Previous Team Leader level of experience in a call center.
  • Bachelor's degree in Finance, or a related field is preferred.
  • Strong knowledge of mutual funds and the financial services industry is preferred.
  • Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Knowledge of industry best practices and compliance requirements.

Regulatory:


• To exercise due care and diligence, ensuring the areas the role is responsible for are organized and controlled.

• To uphold responsibilities for risk and business continuity practices as appropriate to the position the role holds within the organization.

• To comply with the regulatory regimes in which SS&C operates including Consumer Duty, Data Protection, Financial Crime Prevention and CASS regulations.


People Management: All Line Managers are accountable for the following:

  • To communicate openly and honestly with their team
  • To ask, listen and understand the team
  • To be fair and consistent across the team
  • To be accountable for own actions and the actions of the team
  • Absence and performance management


This role offers a unique opportunity to combine your financial expertise, and UK language proficiency to deliver outstanding value to our clients. If you are a dedicated and knowledgeable professional who thrives in a dynamic environment, we encourage you to apply and join our team
